latest.title: Progress Update: CoalSwitch® Commercial Deployment
latest.content:
18 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 8447L
Active Energy Group PLC
18 December 2025
This is a Reach (i.e. non-regulatory) announcement and the information contained is not considered to be material or to have a significant impact on management's expectations of the Company's performance
18 December 2025
Active Energy Group plc
("AEG" or the "Company")
Progress Update: CoalSwitch® Commercial Deployment and Polish Municipal CHP Engagement ICE
Active Energy Group plc (AIM: AEG OTC: ATGVF) provides a further update on the commercial deployment of its CoalSwitch® technology, following the Company's recent announcement regarding the completion of its strategic review and the renewed collaboration with ICE (Indigenous Canadian Energy).
Ongoing Strategic Focus and Poland Engagement
As part of the Board's continued focus on maximising long-term value from CoalSwitch®, AEG senior management recently travelled to Poland to progress discussions with ICE, led by CEO Richard Spinks, and to assess live commercial deployment opportunities within the municipal heat and power sector.
The visit formed part of AEG's wider strategy to move CoalSwitch® beyond evaluation and into practical, revenue-generating applications through partnerships with experienced operators and credible off-takers. Management's on-site engagement reinforced the Board's view that CoalSwitch® can play a meaningful role in coal-replacement markets when deployed alongside proven SEBP expertise.
Progress Toward the First ICE/CoalSwitch® Validation Plant
During the visit, AEG and ICE met with senior management of a large privatised municipal combined heat and power ("CHP") operator supplying approximately 40% of the city's district heating requirements. The CHP operator formally invited ICE, in partnership with AEG, to locate the first ICE/CoalSwitch® validation plant within an existing industrial building adjacent to its operational CHP boilers.
This proposed co-location would allow CoalSwitch® and ICE Black Pellets™ to be validated under real-world operating conditions, using existing infrastructure and live heat and power demand. The opportunity to demonstrate SEBP fuels in a functioning municipal CHP environment was viewed by AEG as a significant step toward unlocking longer-term commercial value.
Key Outcomes of the Engagement
AEG, ICE and the CHP operator have agreed in principle to:
·
Proceed with the commissioning of the ICE/CoalSwitch® validation plant, co-located with the CHP facility;
·
Establish an initial off-take framework for SEBP fuels;
·
Develop a joint commercial framework to support future scale-up opportunities;
·
Progress engineering and commercial documentation for a potential larger-scale facility at the same site, subject to approvals and funding.
The validation plant, which has already been procured, is expected to become operational within approximately six months. It will provide performance data, feedstock validation and operational benchmarks that are critical to assessing future commercial deployment.
Once operational, the facility is intended to act as a reference site for AEG and ICE, enabling international partners and off-takers to evaluate CoalSwitch® performance and assess replication opportunities in other jurisdictions.
Market Context and Strategic Opportunity
Poland remains one of Europe's most coal-dependent district heating markets, with CHP operators under increasing regulatory and economic pressure to transition to lower-emission fuels. CoalSwitch® and ICE Black Pellets™ offer a potential pathway to reduce coal dependency while utilising existing infrastructure.
ICE and AEG's discussions in Poland demonstrated that demand for viable coal-replacement solutions materially exceeds near-term supply. The Board believes this dynamic creates an attractive opportunity to build longer-term value through disciplined project selection, validated deployment and collaboration with experienced partners such as ICE.
Paul Elliott, Executive Director of AEG, commented:
"The Poland visit was an important step in demonstrating how AEG is actively seeking to maximise value from CoalSwitch®. Seeing the technology positioned within a live municipal CHP environment, alongside ICE's operational expertise, reinforced our belief that there is a compelling long-term opportunity to be developed.
Our management team is focused on progressing CoalSwitch® in a measured and commercially credible manner. Working with ICE and Richard Spinks, who bring deep sector knowledge and operational capability, gives AEG a unique opportunity to accelerate deployment while managing risk."
Richard Spinks, CEO of ICE, commented:
"I am pleased to be working closely with AEG's new management team. Their disciplined focus on technical integrity, commercial viability and real-world validation provides a strong foundation for progressing CoalSwitch® in a practical and credible manner.
ICE has developed deep technical expertise in the CoalSwitch® process, and the opportunity to deploy a validation plant alongside an operating CHP facility provides an effective proving environment. This will allow ICE Black Pellets™ and CoalSwitch® to be demonstrated under genuine operating conditions, generating valuable performance data ahead of larger-scale commercial deployment.
The validation facility is intended to serve as an international reference site, enabling municipal and industrial partners to assess feedstocks, review performance and evaluate replication of the commercial plant design within their own markets.
This represents an important milestone for CoalSwitch®, and ICE is pleased to be partnering with AEG on this deployment as we work together to support the transition to scalable, lower-carbon energy solutions."

latest.title: Optimisation of Digital Infrastructure Capacity
latest.content:
16 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 6659L
Active Energy Group PLC
16 December 2025
This announcement contains inside information for the purposes of Article 7 of the UK version of Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 which is part of UK law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended ("MAR"). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
16 December 2025
Active Energy Group plc
("Active Energy", the "Company" or the "Group")
Optimisation of Spare Digital Infrastructure Capacity and Treasury Management
Active Energy Group plc (AIM: AEG OTC: ATGVF), the renewable energy and digital infrastructure company, announces that it intends to utilise spare and transitional capacity across its UAE digital infrastructure network for proprietary Bitcoin mining, as part of its Treasury management strategy.
This strategy is designed to maximise shareholder value by ensuring that additional energy and infrastructure capacity does not sit idle during phased site energisation and prior to full third-party client onboarding. By deploying spare capacity internally, the Company can generate near-term value while continuing to actively contract capacity to third-party hosting, AI, and data infrastructure customers.
Any Bitcoin mined will be held within the Company's Treasury and managed in line with policy limits so that, no more than 30% of the Company's treasury will be held in digital assets at any given time. Where treasury holdings move outside prescribed thresholds, the Company expects to rebalance accordingly, including through the sale of surplus digital assets. Proceeds from any such rebalancing may be reinvested directly into further infrastructure development, supporting the Company's targeted expansion to 100MW of capacity by the end of 2026.
An additional operational advantage of this approach is the acceleration of future client onboarding. By installing and optimising mining equipment in advance, procurement and installation lead times are materially reduced, allowing new customers to become operational within the infrastructure immediately and without delay.
Capacity Update
Further to the Company's RNS dated 6 October 2025, which confirmed that approximately 35% of the capacity at its initial 8MW UAE site had been pre-sold, the Company is pleased to announce that a further 25% of capacity has now been secured under pre-sale arrangements. This brings total pre-sold capacity at the site to approximately 60%. The Company believes this level of pre-commitment demonstrates strong demand for the site and expects the remaining capacity to be fully contracted once the facility becomes operational. The Company currently anticipates the site to be operational towards the end of January 2026.
The Company believes this approach differentiates Active Energy within the market by tightly integrating ultra-low-cost energy generation with flexible, high-performance digital infrastructure. This strategy helps bridge the gap between the energy and digital asset sectors, positioning the Company at the intersection of both.
Paul Elliott,
Chief Executive Officer of Active Energy Group plc
, commented:
"This strategy is a clear example of how Active Energy and its Board continue to look for innovative and disciplined ways to maximise shareholder value. By utilising spare infrastructure capacity efficiently, we avoid idle assets, accelerate cash generation, and maintain full flexibility to support long-term client growth. It also demonstrates how our energy platform and digital infrastructure strategy work together to create a differentiated and scalable business model."
Further updates will be provided as appropriate.

latest.title: CoalSwitch® Strategy and Collaboration with ICE
latest.content:
15 Dec 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 4763L
Active Energy Group PLC
15 December 2025
This is a Reach (i.e. non-regulatory) announcement and the information contained is not considered to be material or to have a significant impact on management's expectations of the Company's performance
15 December 2025
Active Energy Group plc
("AEG" or the "Company")
Strategic Review of CoalSwitch® and Collaboration Agreement with ICE
Active Energy Group plc (AIM: AEG), the international biomass-based alternative energy company, announces the completion of its strategic review of CoalSwitch® and confirms a strengthened collaboration with ICE (Indigenous Canadian Energy) to support the commercialisation of the technology.
Strategic Review & Engagement with ICE
Under the direction of the new management team, including detailed assessment by the Company's Chief Strategy Officer, AEG undertook a comprehensive technical and commercial evaluation of CoalSwitch®. The review concluded that the most effective and commercially viable path forward is to progress the technology in partnership with ICE, led by CEO Richard Spinks and Chairman Grand Chief Ron Derrickson .
Mr. Spinks, who originally introduced and named CoalSwitch® during his earlier tenure as CEO of AEG, has, together with the ICE team, developed significant expertise in Steam-Enhanced Biofuel Pellets (SEBP) and established ICE as a recognised innovator in the sector. ICE's technical maturity, operational experience, and longstanding commitment to advancing SEBP technology were considered key strengths during AEG's evaluation.
The Board believes that renewed collaboration with ICE provides AEG with a clear and accelerated route to commercial deployment of CoalSwitch®.
Development of the ICE/CoalSwitch® Validation Plant
AEG and ICE have agreed to advance development of the first ICE/CoalSwitch® Validation Plant, an industrial-scale facility designed to:
·
Demonstrate CoalSwitch® and ICE SEBP technology in a real-world operational environment;
·
Enable project developers to validate feedstocks at commercial scale;
·
Provide industrial samples for off-takers and financiers;
·
Establish technical benchmarks required for commercial guarantees and project funding.
The Validation Plant will act as a central reference site for global partners seeking validated, bankable biomass solutions. AEG's senior management, including the Chief Strategy Officer, has conducted on-site assessments of ICE's facilities and engineering partners, concluding that ICE's established programme provides a credible foundation for CoalSwitch® commercialisation.
Paul Elliott, Executive Director of AEG, commented:
"Our strategic review confirmed that CoalSwitch® is best advanced alongside experienced partners with an established track record in SEBP technologies. ICE has demonstrated a high level of technical capability and sector leadership, and their alignment with our commercial objectives provides a strong platform for CoalSwitch® to progress toward market deployment.
Richard Spinks and the ICE team have shown consistent commitment to this sector, and their work over recent years has created an opportunity for both companies to move forward with clarity and purpose. We look forward to working together to bring CoalSwitch® into commercial use."
Richard Spinks, CEO of ICE, commented:
"ICE is pleased to re-engage with AEG following its strategic review. CoalSwitch® fits naturally within the SEBP framework we have developed, and the renewed focus from AEG's management team gives us confidence in the direction of travel.
The ICE/CoalSwitch® Validation Plant will provide a commercially relevant demonstration platform for partners and investors. We look forward to supporting AEG as we work together to bring validated SEBP fuels to market."

latest.title: 25-Year Solar Power Purchase Agreement Signed
latest.content:
3 Dec 2025 10:06
RNS Number : 0810K
Active Energy Group PLC
03 December 2025
This announcement contains inside information for the purposes of Article 7 of the UK version of Regulation (EU) No 596/2014 which is part of UK law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended ("MAR"). Upon the publication of this announcement via a Regulatory Information Service, this inside information is now considered to be in the public domain.
3 December 2025
Active Energy Group plc
("Active Energy", the "Company" or the "Group")
New 25-Year Solar Power Purchase Agreement Signed with Cambridge City Football Club
Active Energy Group Plc is pleased to announce that it has entered into a new 25-year Power Purchase Agreement ("
PPA
") worth £0.83 million with Cambridge City Football Club ("
CCFC
"), located at Station Row, Cambridge.
Under the terms of the agreement, AEG will install and operate a rooftop solar generation system at CCFC's facilities, delivering approximately 151,918 kilowatt-hours per annum of clean, renewable electricity at a fixed discounted rate. This long-term arrangement provides CCFC with cost-efficient energy while supporting its sustainability objectives, and further strengthens AEG's portfolio of contracted behind-the-meter solar assets.
This agreement is fully aligned with AEG's rooftop solar strategy, focused on securing long-duration, revenue-generating PPAs with strong community and commercial partners. The Company remains in advanced discussions on a number of additional sites and anticipates further signings in the near term.
Bryan Glendenning, Solar & BESS Advisor at Active Energy Group, commented:
"This latest agreement marks another important milestone in the expansion of our rooftop solar programme. Partnering with community-based organisations such as Cambridge City FC demonstrates the broad reach and effectiveness of our model. We are pleased to deliver long-term savings and clean energy while building a pipeline of high-quality, contracted assets."
Alice Dewey, General Manager of Cambridge City Football Club, added:
"We are delighted to be working with Active Energy Group on this significant sustainability initiative for our Club. The solar installation will reduce our energy costs and carbon footprint, supporting both our operational resilience and our commitment to the community. It's a positive step forward for the future of Cambridge City FC."
Further updates will be provided as appropriate.
